snippet: A deeply flawed appeals court ruling could severely limit enforcement against foreign cartels.
abstract: Editorial criticizes appeals court ruling in case pitting Motorola Mobility against its supplier AU Optronics of Taiwan; holds court's flawed interpretation of American antitrust laws could severely limit enforcement of such laws against foreign cartels that supply critical components for products Americans buy; urges court to reconsider and reverse its decision.
lead_paragraph: A deeply flawed appeals court ruling could severely limit enforcement against foreign cartels.

headline.seo: The Motorola Mobility Ruling and Foreign Cartels
headline.main: A Cramped View of Antitrust Laws
headline.print_headline: A Cramped View of Antitrust Laws
